text: does anyone know if you can disable editor style options in template HubL text tags? here is a screenshot of what I mean <https://drive.google.com/file/d/1AghVQP-54orwlaXa6cBo4iT56ZgqqrHy/view>
<@UG7S8J18D> nope. pretty confident there’s nothing you can do
<@U7SL518D6> thank you. going to post to ideas because I would like to prevent editors from writing any styles whatsoever.
yea, it would be nice to have something like `no_wrapper=true` but for that `no_styles_fo_you=true`
exactly
actually here, try this

it will disable the ability for them to click right in the page(they’ll have to go to edit modules) but you could `export_to_template_context=true` the field then `{{content.widgets.your_field_name.body.value}}`

where you want to render it.

not 100% sure that my second snippet is correct might be slightly off. check dev info to find the correct way to call it
If you implement it that way, there should be no way to style it, the con being, you can’t click on the text in the page itself to edit it
nice solution but we have pretty granular permissions to prevent giving them design manager access
no they dont need design manager permission
no_styles_no_code for you
that’s not what I meant
the “edit modules” pane in the page editor that’s what that pane is called that you had open in your screencast
ahh thanks never done that type of thing before
so you declare the module and put that value where you need it

<@U7SL518D6> So weird, right before I posted my question I installed your chrome extension. Thank you for building that it is really nice. I kept on googling the HubSpot documentation so this will help a lot.
you're everywhere man

haha, no problem.

BTW if you go to the develop tab in the extension - you probably will want to enable atleast 1 of those toggles. (the developer menu). It’s one of the most liked features, unfortunately people just haven’t been noticing it as much as I would have expected.
what does that do?
I have it enabled do
look at your main menu bar in HubSpot
… your welcome :stuck_out_tongue:
:partyparrot: I think your done for the day
thanks Jon

The other toggle if you haven’t tried it applies a dark theme to the design manager. If you’re like me and several others, that white get’s blinding, thus the dark theme, if you ever have feedback on the extension hit us up in <#CBBAW6Z3R|community-browser-extension>
